ygData.subject: Re: Level 9 - Leather Armor
ygData.msgSnippet: Well I have been playing for awhile. I dont know what you are spending you money on but I had an entire suit of leather by 7th level. I guess its how you play.
ygData.messageBody:
Well I have been playing for awhile. I dont know what you are spending you
money on but I had an entire suit of leather by 7th level. I guess its how
you play. You get in a hurry and wanna kill everythig in site, waste time
screwing around ect. Patience is key. Get your armor. Get prepared before
you start "adventuring". The ill prepared seems to always die. Ya it gets
mundane. Sometime you have to kill stuff that doesnt give you exp. But its
easy to make 5 plat in a night or more killing bugs, spiders and skels. The
armor...not that patchwork garbage will pay you back 10 fold. If you make it
fine no prob. But I did not make squat, wouldnt buy it or wear it. Im 20ish
level now in what 3 weeks? and no im not 24 7 player. Just being prepared is
the key and knowing the bard. The patchwork is a waste of money and skill
points i will always say :-) Play smart Play Prepared. That scarab will tear
you up in patchwork. In leather you will solo it.

Greg

>Being a tailor, I take exception to this statement. Of course, I
>do respect your opinion.
>
>Just by a piece of leather or
>> raw hide, (same stats cept raw-hide is heavier) You can get a full suit
of
>> leather for about 20 plat.
>Hahah, easy for a higher level player to say. Patchwork, going for
>about 2pp per piece, or less with quantity, is within reach of the
>low level players.
>The fact that several pieces of armour are not available in patchwork
>means you should do both IMHO. Buy the patchwork (or make it) at a
>lower level, and upgrade as you can affort it, purchasing those
>pieces that aren't available as patchwork first. I see no point
>in shelling out for a leather tunic when you have a patchwork tunic,
>but no shoulder pads or face mask. Sure, a tunic has higher AC, but
>I think that a patchwork tunic plus another piece of leather (or two)
>would have higher AC than the leather tunic alone.
>
>> Patchwork...blah. Waste of skill points and
>> money.
>Again, I disagree. Studded and reinforced, well, that's another
>discussion.
